data.title: Scotland vs Denmark LIVE: World Cup qualifier result, final score and reaction tonight
data.meta_description: Follow all the action live from Hampden Park
data.text:
Scotland welcome Denmark to Hampden Park this evening as Steve Clarke’s side look to end their World Cup qualifying campaign on a high note, having already sealed a place in the play-offs ahead of next winter’s tournament in Qatar.

Scotland’s 2-0 victory over Moldova on Friday ensured Clarke’s team will finish in second place in Group F, with tonight’s opponents Denmark guaranteed to win the pool. The Danes have won all nine of their qualifying fixtures, having beaten Scotland 2-0 in Copenhagen back in September – though the scoreline could have been much more lopsided against the Scots. Still, this is no dead-rubber for Scotland, who are now aiming to finish as one of the six best second-placed sides, which would give them a seeding in next March’s play-off games. A result here could significantly boost Scotland’s hopes of achieving a home semi-final draw in those play-offs, so Clarke and his players will be keen for a sharp performance in front of the Hampden Park faithful this evening.

Scotland’s presence at Euro 2020 this summer marked their first appearance at a major tournament since the 1998 World Cup, so qualifying for Qatar 2022 would see them play at a world championship for the first time in 24 years.

Follow live updates from Scotland vs Denmark below.

Scotland vs Denmark LIVE

Scotland have already secured spot in qualifying play-offs

Scotland XI: Gordon, O’Donnell, Souttar, Robertson, Tierney, McGinn, McGregor, Adams, Christie, Gilmour, Cooper

Denmark XI: Schmeichel, Vestergaard, Kjaer, Christensen, Kristensen, Wass, Jonsson, Maehle, Skov Olsen, Cornelius, Bruun Larsen

35 mins: Souttar heads home opener for Scotland

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:24 , Dylan Terry

82 mins: Into the last 10 minutes we go as Denmark’s press for an equaliser appears to have tapered off following a number of changes and breaks in play.

Tierney flicks a cross away for a Danish corner. Fatigue setting in. Not long to go.

Other scores

21:23 , Dylan Terry

In case any Scotland fan at all is interested, here are the other scores for the home nations with 10 minutes remaining:

Northern Ireland 0-0 Italy

San Marino 0-10 (TEN) England

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:21 , Dylan Terry

80 mins: Scotland captain Andy Robertson has gone down here. A concern for the country and for Liverpool.

SUBS! Robertson hobbles off and is replaced by Scott McKenna. Ryan Christie has also gone off for Stuart Armstrong.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:20 , Dylan Terry

78 mins: Che Adams has been magnificent at holding the ball up for Scotland tonight and giving them an outlet high up the pitch. But his legs are starting to tire now and he is dropping deeper as a result. The Scottish defenders no longer have that long pass option and are subsequently welcoming pressure.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:18 , Dylan Terry

76 mins: Scotland cannot get out of their own half now. It’s going to be a backs to the wall-type job for the final 15 minutes as Denmark continue to stalk their prey.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:16 , Dylan Terry

74 mins: It’s neat build-up play in the middle third from Denmark but as soon as Kristensen looks for that killer pass it’s so poor.

SUB! That is Gilmour’s last moments in the game as Kenny McLean comes on in his place.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:14 , Dylan Terry

72 mins: Denmark having a lot of the ball now but not doing much with it. Here comes another substitution.

Uhre is on for striker Cornelius. The Danish forward has had very little to feed off of tonight.

Meanwhile, Billy Gilmour looks like he has cramp. He is going to continue for the time being.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:11 , Dylan Terry

69 mins: McGinn has been absolutely superb tonight. He appears to have won a free-kick on the byline after drifting beyond Kristensen but the ball had already gone out of play.

The Aston Villa man has been a pest all evening for that Danish back line.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:09 , Dylan Terry

67 mins: Midway through the second half and Scotland are on their way to a sensational victory as it stands. The phone lights are out in force from the thousands in attendance - they’re in party mood.

But it’s heart in mouth stuff for a moment as one, two, three Denmark shots are blocked from inside the box. Souttar then rises highest to head a couple of crosses away before Scotland relieve the pressure by winning a throw.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:07 , Dylan Terry

This has been an excellent battle this evening. McGinn getting the better of it.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:06 , Dylan Terry

64 mins: The crowd are on their feet once more as McGinn lobs a delicate ball into the path of Adams. He takes it down and thumps a low drive against the base of the post and then the assistant referee’s flag goes up.

Replays show he was perhaps a shoulder’s width offside.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:04 , Dylan Terry

62 mins: NOW THAT WOULD HAVE BEEN SPECIAL.

O’Donnell’s throw-in is chested down by Gilmour and he takes a speculative shot on the bounce. For a moment it looks destined to loop over Schmeichel but in the end the Leicester man is able to pluck it out of the sky.

The crowd would have lost it had that gone in.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:03 , Dylan Terry

Denmark do only have 400,000 more people in their population than Scotland (according to a quick Google). So would this really be that much of an upset? I mean, yes, but an interesting point nevertheless.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

21:01 , Dylan Terry

59 mins: Olsen cuts the ball back and delivers an inswinging ball which Cornelius attacks but Souttar sees him all the way and it harmlessly rolls out for a goal kick.

Denmark slowly getting on top although (offside header aside) they are still yet to create anything substantial.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:58 , Dylan Terry

57 mins: SUBS! Sisto is on for Larsen and Jonsson has made way for Stage. Double change from Hjulmand as he looks to shake things up.

He needs to.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:56 , Dylan Terry

54 mins: WHAT A SAVE! The flag is up but let’s just appreciate the save from Craig Gordon.

It’s lofted into the left-hand side of the penalty area and when Larsen heads back across goal Cornelius plants a header towards the near post only for Gordon to tip it away superbly! There was an offside in the build up, but the Scotland number one had no idea.

Wonderful stop.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:55 , Dylan Terry

53 mins: Bit of space opening up in between the lines of Scotland at the start of this second half. Christensen drifts into a pocket and looks to find Larsen out on the left but he overhits the sweeping pass.

Denmark just enjoying a spell of possession here.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:52 , Dylan Terry

51 mins: It’s a carnival atmosphere at Hampden Park right now. If they do win this game, Steve Clarke would become the first Scottish manager to win six games in a row since Alex McLeish.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:50 , Dylan Terry

48 mins: Olsen tries to beat Tierney down the right but the Arsenal man is equal to it and it comes back off the Dane for a Scotland goal kick.

Been that sort of evening for the visitors so far...

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:48 , Dylan Terry

46 mins: BACK UNDERWAY! Denmark begin the second half. They need to be much, much better if they want to maintain their 100 per cent record in the campaign.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:47 , Dylan Terry

Second half incoming. Can the Scots hang on to the lead? I say hang on, if the first period is anything to go by they may feel like extending their advantage.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:42 , Dylan Terry

A moment to remember for John Souttar.

HALF-TIME: Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:33 , Dylan Terry

That will do for the first 45 minutes at Hampden Park. What a sensational performance from Scotland!

Steve Clarke side lead courtesy of a close-range header from John Souttar after an excellent nod back across goal from Liam Cooper.

Wonderful display so far from the Scots.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:32 , Dylan Terry

45 mins: That was a chance for Denmark!

Olsen curls a ball towards the back post and it falls for Wass. The Dane’s effort is heading into the bottom corner but Tierney gets a flick on it to crucially divert it wide.

The visitors’ best chance of the game.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:31 , Dylan Terry

44 mins: England might be 6-0 up against San Marino but it is here where the performance of the night is coming from. Scotland have been utterly irrepressible in this first period.

It’s just a matter of whether or not they can keep this intensity up.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:29 , Dylan Terry

Here it is.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:29 , Dylan Terry

42 mins: Denmark probe 40 yards from the Scotland goal but Robertson nicks the ball and the hosts can come away with it.

The Dane’s haven’t really laid a glove on Scotland over the last 20 minutes or so.

Clarke’s men professionally seeing this one out to the break.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:27 , Dylan Terry

40 mins: Are Denmark about to lose their first game since the European Championships?

Scotland have totally outplayed them for 40 minutes here. One. Way. Traffic.

Scotland 1-0 Denmark

20:25 , Dylan Terry

38 mins: Aaaaaand breathe. That was a moment for all of Scotland to saviour.

But they have to stay alert as soon as play gets back underway. Maehle storms down the left and earns a corner for the away side, their first of the game.

It comes to nothing though. Scotland are defending absolutely superbly.

GOAL! Scotland 1-0 Denmark (Souttar, 35)

20:22 , Dylan Terry

35 mins: CAN YOU BELIEVE IT?!

Scotland’s seventh corner presents an eighth and it’s from that one where the home side find the breakthrough!

McGinn swings it all the way to the back post and when it’s knocked back into the six-yard box John Souttar is there to flick home from close range!

Pandemonium at Hampden!

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:21 , Dylan Terry

34 mins: Big chance for Scotland! Denmark are pressing up the pitch and caught napping by the Scots.

It’s two-on-one as Robertson brings it down for Adams. The Saints man looks up and opts to shoot but it’s blocked behind by Kjaer. He should have given it back to Robertson! The Liverpool man was open inside the box. Wrong decision.

It’s coming though...

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:20 , Dylan Terry

32 mins: Denmark just taking the sting out of the game a little as they knock it around at the back. Dare I say Schmeichel is already running down the clock in this first half?

If there is going to be a goal before the break, it is almost certainly going to come from the home team.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:17 , Dylan Terry

Denmark coach Hjulmand will know his team are in a dogfight here. They have been largely outplayed for the opening 30 minutes.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:16 , Dylan Terry

29 mins: Scotland on the march again! Robertson crosses from the left and it falls to McGinn whose shot is blocked behind for a corner - the hosts fifth already!

It’s swung in by McGinn and Kjaer has to get back on the goal line to preventing it going straight in at the near post!

The Danes on the ropes.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:15 , Dylan Terry

28 mins: Jannik Vestergaard isn’t known for his distribution and his latest pass showcases why.

The Leicester defender tries to curl a sweeping ball towards the back post but it’s around 20 yards too deep.

Maybe he was picking out someone he knew in the front row? Benefit of the doubt.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:13 , Dylan Terry

26 mins: Few breaks in play here as a couple of cheap free-kicks and offsides are given.

Denmark composing themselves after a strong spell for the hosts.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:12 , Dylan Terry

As an Englishman, I endorse this.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:11 , Dylan Terry

23 mins: HUGE CHANCE!

Oh, what a move from Scotland. A lovely dinked ball finds Gilmour. He cuts it back for Christie who bundles it into the path of Adams but the Southampton man is denied by the outstretched leg of Schmeichel!

Superb stop. Great play from the Scots.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:09 , Dylan Terry

23 mins: YELLOW! Denmark keeper Schmeichel has gone in the book, the first card of the night.

It seems it was for descent after he berated the referee, indicating he needs glasses when a goal kick/corner decision did not go his way. Silly boy.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:07 , Dylan Terry

21 mins: McGinn swings in the corner which is on top of Schmeichel but headed clear inside the six yard box for another corner.

This one comes in from Gilmour but the referee has seen an infringement from a Scottish player.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:06 , Dylan Terry

20 mins: Christie tries to make something happen as he drives down the right of the penalty area but his cross is headed clear.

Adams then latches onto a loose ball and shrugs off Kjaer to earn his side a corner.

Scotland pushing Denmark back after a difficult 10 minutes.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:04 , Dylan Terry

17 mins: CLOSE! Chelsea centre-back Andreas Christensen lines one up from 25 yards and let’s fly. It initially looks dangerous but ends up soaring just over the top.

We know he can hit them. Remember that one in the Euros?

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

20:01 , Dylan Terry

14 mins: After a very dominant opening seven or eight minutes, Scotland are now reverting to their defensive shape as Denmark start to ping it around.

If Steve Clarke’s side are going to get a positive result then they need to be patient because there will be spells without the ball.

Maehle skips away as a bit of room opens up behind Scotland. Eventually the hosts are able to snuff him out on the edge of the box but there was another warning sign.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

19:58 , Dylan Terry

11 mins: Chance for Denmark! They’re getting a bit of space all of a sudden, the visitors.

Larsen clips a ball from the right in towards Wass but his header drifts wide of the post.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

19:55 , Dylan Terry

9 mins: Denmark get their foot on the ball for the first time. It’s intricate play down the left from Maehle who finds Olsen only for him to slip and see the ball roll out of play.

The Scots loving that.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

19:54 , Dylan Terry

7 mins: McGinn fouled again by Vestergaard as Scotland enjoy a large amount of possession in the Denmark half in the opening minutes of this game.

Worth mentioning the referee tonight has dished out 18 yellow cards in his last two La Liga games.

Expect bookings then.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

19:52 , Dylan Terry

5 mins: Scotland captain Robertson controls a long ball from McGinn wonderfully well but is penalised for using his arm. Harsh.

Robertson and McGinn starting well down the left, probing that side.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

19:49 , Dylan Terry

3 mins: Hampden Park is absolutely rocking this evening. It’s not hard to work out what they think of this Scotland team. Clarke has created a buoyant mood around the national side.

John McGinn wins himself a free-kick in the early exchanges, battling and fighting for the ball with Vestergaard.

Scotland 0-0 Denmark

19:47 , Dylan Terry

1 min: KICK OFF! Away we go at Hampden Park as the hosts get us underway.

The players and fans pay tribute to Walter Smith and Bertie Auld with a minute’s silence before the match.

Scotland vs Denmark

19:42 , Dylan Terry

Almost ready to go at Hampden Park. A quick reminder of the two teams.

Scotland vs Denmark

19:40 , Dylan Terry

Che Adams found the back of the net last time out against Moldova. Can he do the same against much better opposition this evening?

Scotland vs Denmark

19:35 , Dylan Terry

Kick-off is just 10 minutes away at Hampden Park and the crowd are beginning to find their voice ahead of Scotland’s final World Cup qualifier for Qatar 2022.

Can Steve Clarke’s men live up to the hype they have created from five successive wins?

Scotland vs Denmark

19:31 , Dylan Terry

There is one thing on the line tonight. If Scotland win they can secure themselves a home draw for the semi-finals of the play-offs in March.

Could prove crucial.

Scotland vs Denmark

19:26 , Dylan Terry

Denmark boss Kasper Hjulmand has masterminded a generation of Danish players who can legitimately call themselves one of the best sides in Europe.

The real test will come next year when they head to the World Cup. But they could not have done any more in this qualification campaign. If they win tonight, they will be the only side to finish with maximum points.

Scotland vs Denmark

19:21 , Dylan Terry

Elsewhere tonight:

San Marino vs England

Northern Ireland vs Italy

Switzerland vs Bulgaria

Austria vs Moldova

Israel vs Faroe Islands

Albania vs Andorra

Poland vs Hungary

Scotland vs Denmark

19:16 , Dylan Terry

Simply a lovely little moment.

Scotland vs Denmark

19:11 , Dylan Terry

Scotland have won five World Cup qualifiers in a row, a run that stretches back to their defeat against Denmark at the beginning September.

Since then, they have beaten Moldova twice, Austria, Israel and the Faroe Islands in a superb run of results for Steve Clarke’s men.

Scotland vs Denmark

19:06 , Dylan Terry

Ally McCoist in the house at Hampden Park for the game this evening. A living legend, I think we can all agree.

Scotland vs Denmark

19:01 , Dylan Terry

Denmark have conceded just one goal in their six games since losing to England in semi-finals of Euro 2020.

The Dane’s have won all their matches since the summer and come into this one in scintillating form.

Scotland vs Denmark

18:56 , Dylan Terry

When the two sides met back in September Denmark were able to win 2-0 thanks to two goals in as many minutes.

Strikes from Daniel Wass and Joakim Maehle gave the Dane’s another solid victory as they continue to build on their semi-final run at the European Championships in the summer.

World Cup Qualification table

18:51 , Dylan Terry

Here is the table heading into tonight’s game. Denmark have secured their place in Qatar as the group winners and Scotland have already clinched a play-off place.

But can the Scots clinch a famous win tonight?

Scotland vs Denmark

18:46 , Dylan Terry

Scotland are looking to keep their positive form going with another impressive display tonight. Will they prevent Denmark from making it 10 wins out of 10 in this World Cup qualifying campaign?

Scotland vs Denmark

18:41 , Dylan Terry

Denmark XI: Schmeichel, Vestergaard, Kjaer, Christensen, Kristensen, Wass, Jonsson, Maehle, Skov Olsen, Cornelius, Bruun Larsen.

Scotland vs Denmark

18:32 , Alex Pattle

Scotland bench: Clark, McLaughlin, Ralston, Porteous, McKenna, Armstrong, Turnbull, Nisbet, Ferguson, Brown, McLean.

Scotland vs Denmark

18:31 , Alex Pattle

Scotland XI: Gordon, O’Donnell, Souttar, Robertson, Tierney, McGinn, McGregor, Adams, Christie, Gilmour, Cooper.

Scotland vs Denmark

18:16 , Alex Pattle

Scotland welcome Denmark to Hampden Park this evening as Steve Clarke’s side look to end their World Cup qualifying campaign on a high note, having already sealed a place in the play-offs ahead of next winter’s tournament in Qatar.

Scotland’s 2-0 victory over Moldova on Friday ensured Clarke’s team will finish in second place in Group F, with tonight’s opponents Denmark guaranteed to win the pool. The Danes have won all nine of their qualifying fixtures, having beaten Scotland 2-0 in Copenhagen back in September – though the scoreline could have been much more lopsided against the Scots. Still, this is no dead-rubber for Scotland, who are now aiming to finish as one of the six best second-placed sides, which would give them a seeding in next March’s play-off games. A result here could significantly boost Scotland’s hopes of achieving a home semi-final draw in those play-offs, so Clarke and his players will be keen for a sharp performance in front of the Hampden Park faithful this evening.

Scotland’s presence at Euro 2020 this summer marked their first appearance at a major tournament since the 1998 World Cup, so qualifying for Qatar 2022 would see them play at a world championship for the first time in 24 years.
